\doxysubsection{Member Function Documentation}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{classKBLASMemoryTree_a5cbaa382cb85f4175bbbfff0cf835f82}\label{classKBLASMemoryTree_a5cbaa382cb85f4175bbbfff0cf835f82}} 
\index{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$@{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$}!fetch@{fetch}}
\index{fetch@{fetch}!KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$@{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{fetch()}{fetch()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily template$<$int K$>$ \\
void \mbox{\hyperlink{classKBLASMemoryTree}{KBLASMemory\+Tree}}$<$ K $>$\+::fetch (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{classaccess__t}{access\+\_\+t}} $\ast$}]{access,  }\item[{device\+\_\+global\+\_\+id\+\_\+t}]{device\+\_\+global\+\_\+id }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}, {\ttfamily [virtual]}}

Fetch the access on the given device 

Implements \mbox{\hyperlink{classMemoryCoherencyController}{Memory\+Coherency\+Controller}}.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{classKBLASMemoryTree_af477dd1d15f6796fe544d601f1a9c1ed}\label{classKBLASMemoryTree_af477dd1d15f6796fe544d601f1a9c1ed}} 
\index{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$@{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$}!fetch\_list\_reduce@{fetch\_list\_reduce}}
\index{fetch\_list\_reduce@{fetch\_list\_reduce}!KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$@{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{fetch\_list\_reduce()}{fetch\_list\_reduce()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily template$<$int K$>$ \\
static void \mbox{\hyperlink{classKBLASMemoryTree}{KBLASMemory\+Tree}}$<$ K $>$\+::fetch\+\_\+list\+\_\+reduce (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structKBLASMemoryTree_1_1fetch__list__t}{fetch\+\_\+list\+\_\+t}} $\ast$}]{list }\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}, {\ttfamily [static]}}

Given two regions \textquotesingle{}a\textquotesingle{} and \textquotesingle{}b\textquotesingle{} we note \textquotesingle{}a -\/$>$ b\textquotesingle{} if \textquotesingle{}a\textquotesingle{} and \textquotesingle{}b\textquotesingle{} are consecutive in memory, with \textquotesingle{}b\textquotesingle{} being right-\/after \textquotesingle{}a\textquotesingle{}. We note a+b the merged (continuous) memory region.

Given a passed list of region L = \mbox{[}a, b, c, d, e\mbox{]} with a-\/$>$c and e-\/$>$d, this routine updates the list so that it becomes L = \mbox{[}a+c, b, e+d\mbox{]}

A fetch list element is not only a region, but also has a\+:
\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item a source device
\item a destinatary device which needs to match between elements so they are merged.
\end{DoxyItemize}

Note at this point, the list is a partition of an access, so there cannot be overlap between represented regions

case (1) n -\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/---$>$ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$\+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+$\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ $\vert$ $\vert$\+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+$\vert$ v

or n -\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/---$>$ $\vert$ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$\+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+$\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$\+\_\+\+\_\+\+\_\+\+\_\+\+\_\+\+\_\+\+\_\+$\vert$ $\vert$ v

or n -\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/-\/---$>$ $\vert$ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$ $\vert$\+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+ \+\_\+$\vert$\+\_\+ \+\_\+$\vert$ $\vert$ v\mbox{\Hypertarget{classKBLASMemoryTree_ae32ab972fe94b52d8845aae07e67069f}\label{classKBLASMemoryTree_ae32ab972fe94b52d8845aae07e67069f}} 
\index{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$@{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$}!invalidate@{invalidate}}
\index{invalidate@{invalidate}!KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$@{KBLASMemoryTree$<$ K $>$}}
